CatDescriptText: Rosie Ellis, medical technician, Fifth Ward and Harry Maybury, teletype repairman, Monroeville, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 14, 1961, pg. B1 with question: "At what age should young folks be allowed to have unchaperoned parties?" Rosie Ellis' answer reads: "Around 17.  At that age, they should know how to conduct themselves."  Harry Maybury's answer reads: "If the parents are in the house, I would say between the ages of 12 and 17.  At the other ages, the kids are wilder.  Actually they are not stable until around 25."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Rosie Ellis wearing light colored coat, standing in front of textured building; Portrait of Harry Maybury wearing hat, eyeglasses, striped scarf, and herringbone coat, standing in front of building, another version
